titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. George W. Hook, Jesse Brashers, John Key, David Grigsby & Daniel Smith & Drewry Godsey, Indictment
CWG5478

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Perry Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
agst } Indict
Geo. W. Houk, Jesse Brashers, John Key, David Grigsby & Daniel Smith & Drewry Godsey

The Grand Jury of Perry County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Geo. W. Houk, Jesse Brashears, John Key, Daniel Grigsby and Daniel Smith ^& Drewry Godsey^ of the crime of murder, committed as follows to wit, the six afrsd. persons, did in the County aforesaid in the 12th day of Oct. 1865, unlawfully and with malice aforethought kill and murder. Nelson Moody ^Gilbert Creech^, by shooting him with Guns and pistols, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

witnesses Shode Combs & H. F. Finley
Comlth Atty
A Copy
Commonwealth
agst } Indict
Geo. W. Hank
